lines.content: - IDKName Chatbot is a JavaFX desktop app for managing tasks with simple commands.
- It features a retro game-inspired interface and a task manager backend.
- Users type commands in the input box, and the bot replies in the main chat area with feedback, errors, or the task list.
1. Open IntelliJ (if you have a project open, click **File > Close Project** first).
- Click **OK** and accept defaults for any further prompts.
If setup is correct, you can move on to the chatbot!
Shows all tasks currently in your task list, along with their type and completion status.
Exits the chatbot gracefully and saves all tasks to file.
Marks the task with the given ID as completed.
Unmarks the task with the given ID (sets it back to not done).
Searches the task list for tasks containing the keyword in their description.
Creates a simple todo task with the given description.
Creates a deadline task with the given description and a due date.
Creates an event task scheduled between a start and end date/time
Sorts all tasks in the list by type (Todos, Deadlines, Events).
Sorts and displays tasks filtered by the given type.
If you need any help for the instructions!
This project uses **Gradle** as its build tool.
- IDKName Chatbot is a JavaFX desktop app for managing tasks with simple commands.
- It features a retro game-inspired interface and a task manager backend.
- Users type commands in the input box, and the bot replies in the main chat area with feedback, errors, or the task list.
1. Open IntelliJ (if you have a project open, click **File > Close Project** first).
- Click **OK** and accept defaults for any further prompts.
If setup is correct, you can move on to the chatbot!
Shows all tasks currently in your task list, along with their type and completion status.
Exits the chatbot gracefully and saves all tasks to file.
Marks the task with the given ID as completed.
Unmarks the task with the given ID (sets it back to not done).
Searches the task list for tasks containing the keyword in their description.
Creates a simple todo task with the given description.
Creates a deadline task with the given description and a due date.
Creates an event task scheduled between a start and end date/time
Sorts all tasks in the list by type (Todos, Deadlines, Events).
Sorts and displays tasks filtered by the given type.
If you need any help for the instructions!
This project uses **Gradle** as its build tool.
* Represents an abstract task with a description and completion status.
* Subclasses (Todo, Deadline, Event) provide additional fields and behavior.
* Constructs a Task with the given description.
* By default, tasks are not marked as done.
* @param description the description of the task
* Returns the type of this task as a single-letter code.
* For example: "T" for Todo, "D" for Deadline, "E" for Event.
* @return the type code of the task
* Returns the due date of this task if it is a Deadline.
* @return the due date, or null if not applicable
* Returns the time period of this task if it is an Event.
* @return an array of LocalDateTime [start, end], or null if not applicable
* Returns whether this task is marked as done.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise
* Returns the description of the task
* Returns string representation of a marked task
* @return "X" if task is done and nothing otherwise
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Marks Task done and prints message if called by the user (load is false)
*  Marks Task done and not print message if not called by the user (load is true)
*  Prints different message if task already marked as done
* @param load the boolean to check if loaded
return String.format("Task already marked as done: %n%s", this);
return String.format("Nice! I've marked this task as done: %n%s", this);
* Marks Task undone and prints message
* Prints different message if task already marked as done
return String.format("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: %n%s", this);
return String.format("Task already marked as not done: %n%s", this);
* Returns a String representation of task description and mark/unmark sign
* Compares this task with the specified object for equality.
* Two tasks are considered equal if they have the same description,
* @param o the object to compare with
* @return true if this task is equal to the specified object; false otherwise
* Handles reading from and writing to a persistent storage file
* that contains the user's task list.
* Tasks are stored in plain text format, with fields separated by "|".
* Supported task types: Todo (T), Deadline (D), Event (E).
* Constructs a Storage object responsible for persisting a given task list.
* @param tasks    the task list to read from or write to
* @param filePath the path to the storage file
* Saves the current tasks to the storage file.
* Creates parent directories if they do not exist.
* Tasks are serialized in the following formats:
* @throws IOException if an error occurs during writing
* Loads tasks from the storage file into the associated task list.
* Expected line formats are the same as in {@link #save()}.
* @throws FileNotFoundException if the storage file does not exist
// will always have 3 parts as that's the basic necessity to create a task
